022package com.restfb;
023
024import static com.restfb.util.StringUtils.isBlank;
025import static java.util.Collections.unmodifiableList;
026
027import java.util.List;
028import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
029import java.util.Optional;
030import java.util.stream.Collectors;
031
032import com.restfb.exception.FacebookJsonMappingException;
033import com.restfb.json.Json;
034import com.restfb.json.JsonArray;
035import com.restfb.json.JsonObject;
036import com.restfb.json.ParseException;
037import com.restfb.util.ReflectionUtils;
038
039/**
040 * Represents a <a href="http://developers.facebook.com/docs/api">Graph API Connection type</a>.
041 *
042 * @param <T>
043 *          The Facebook type
044 * @author <a href="http://restfb.com">Mark Allen</a>
045 */
046public class Connection<T> implements Iterable<List<T>> {
047  private FacebookClient facebookClient;
048  private Class<T> connectionType;
049  private List<T> data;
050  private String previousPageUrl;
051  private String nextPageUrl;
052  private Long totalCount;
053  private String beforeCursor;
054  private String afterCursor;
055  private String order;
056
057  /**
058   * @see java.lang.Iterable#iterator()
059   * @since 1.6.7
060   */
061  @Override
062  public ConnectionIterator<T> iterator() {
063    return new Itr<>(this);
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Iterator over connection pages.
068   * 
069   * @author <a href="http://restfb.com">Mark Allen</a>
070   * @since 1.6.7
071   */
072  protected static class Itr<T> implements ConnectionIterator<T> {
073    private Connection<T> connection;
074    private boolean initialPage = true;
075
076    /**
077     * Creates a new iterator over the given {@code connection}.
078     * 
079     * @param connection
080     *          The connection over which to iterate.
081     */
082    protected Itr(Connection<T> connection) {
083      this.connection = connection;
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * @see java.util.Iterator#hasNext()
088     */
089    @Override
090    public boolean hasNext() {
091      // Special case: initial page will always have data
092      return initialPage || connection.hasNext();
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * @see java.util.Iterator#next()
097     */
098    @Override
099    public List<T> next() {
100      // Special case: initial page will always have data, return it
101      // immediately.
102      if (initialPage) {
103        initialPage = false;
104        return connection.getData();
105      }
106
107      if (!connection.hasNext()) {
108        throw new NoSuchElementException("There are no more pages in the connection.");
109      }
110
111      connection = connection.fetchNextPage();
112      return connection.getData();
113    }
114
115    /**
116     * @see java.util.Iterator#remove()
117     */
118    @Override
119    public void remove() {
120      throw new UnsupportedOperationException(Itr.class.getSimpleName() + " doesn't support the remove() operation.");
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * @see ConnectionIterator#snapshot()
125     */
126    @Override
127    public Connection<T> snapshot() {
128      return connection;
129    }
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Creates a connection with the given {@code jsonObject}.
134   * 
135   * @param facebookClient
136   *          The {@code FacebookClient} used to fetch additional pages and map data to JSON objects.
137   * @param json
138   *          Raw JSON which must include a {@code data} field that holds a JSON array and optionally a {@code paging}
139   *          field that holds a JSON object with next/previous page URLs.
140   * @param connectionType
141   *          Connection type token.
142   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
143   *           If the provided {@code json} is invalid.
144   * @since 1.6.7
145   */
146  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
147  public Connection(FacebookClient facebookClient, String json, Class<T> connectionType) {
148    JsonObject jsonObject;
149
150    try {
151      jsonObject = Optional.ofNullable(json).map(j -> Json.parse(j).asObject()).orElseThrow(() -> new FacebookJsonMappingException("You must supply non-null connection JSON."));
152    } catch (ParseException e) {
153      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("The connection JSON you provided was invalid: " + json, e);
154    }
155
156    // Pull out data
157    JsonArray jsonData = jsonObject.get("data").asArray();
158    List<T> dataItem = jsonData.valueStream().map(jsonValue -> connectionType.equals(JsonObject.class) ? (T) jsonValue
159            : facebookClient.getJsonMapper().toJavaObject(jsonValue.toString(), connectionType)).collect(Collectors.toList());
160
161    // Pull out paging info, if present
162    if (jsonObject.contains("paging")) {
163      JsonObject jsonPaging = jsonObject.get("paging").asObject();
164      previousPageUrl = fixProtocol(jsonPaging.getString("previous", null));
165      nextPageUrl = fixProtocol(jsonPaging.getString("next", null));
166
167      // handle cursors
168      if (jsonPaging.contains("cursors")) {
169        JsonObject jsonCursors = jsonPaging.get("cursors").asObject();
170        beforeCursor = jsonCursors.getString("before", null);
171        afterCursor = jsonCursors.getString("after", null);
172      }
173    } else {
174      previousPageUrl = null;
175      nextPageUrl = null;
176    }
177
178    if (jsonObject.contains("summary")) {
179      JsonObject jsonSummary = jsonObject.get("summary").asObject();
180      totalCount = jsonSummary.contains("total_count") ? jsonSummary.getLong("total_count", 0L) : null;
181      order = jsonSummary.getString("order","");
182    } else {
183      totalCount = null;
184      order = null;
185    }
186
187    this.data = unmodifiableList(dataItem);
188    this.facebookClient = facebookClient;
189    this.connectionType = connectionType;
190  }
191
192  /**
193   * Fetches the next page of the connection. Designed to be used by {@link Itr}.
194   *
195   * @return The next page of the connection.
196   * @since 1.6.7
197   */
198  protected Connection<T> fetchNextPage() {
199    return facebookClient.fetchConnectionPage(getNextPageUrl(), connectionType);
200  }
201
202  @Override
203  public String toString() {
204    return ReflectionUtils.toString(this);
205  }
206
207  @Override
208  public boolean equals(Object object) {
209    return ReflectionUtils.equals(this, object);
210  }
211
212  @Override
213  public int hashCode() {
214    return ReflectionUtils.hashCode(this);
215  }
216
217  /**
218   * Data for this connection.
219   *
220   * @return Data for this connection.
221   */
222  public List<T> getData() {
223    return data;
224  }
225
226  /**
227   * This connection's "previous page of data" URL.
228   *
229   * @return This connection's "previous page of data" URL, or {@code null} if there is no previous page.
230   * @since 1.5.3
231   */
232  public String getPreviousPageUrl() {
233    return previousPageUrl;
234  }
235
236  /**
237   * This connection's "next page of data" URL.
238   *
239   * @return This connection's "next page of data" URL, or {@code null} if there is no next page.
240   * @since 1.5.3
241   */
242  public String getNextPageUrl() {
243    return nextPageUrl;
244  }
245
246  /**
247   * Does this connection have a previous page of data?
248   *
249   * @return {@code true} if there is a previous page of data for this connection, {@code false} otherwise.
250   */
251  public boolean hasPrevious() {
252    return !isBlank(getPreviousPageUrl());
253  }
254
255  /**
256   * Does this connection have a next page of data?
257   *
258   * @return {@code true} if there is a next page of data for this connection, {@code false} otherwise.
259   */
260  public boolean hasNext() {
261    return !isBlank(getNextPageUrl()) && !getData().isEmpty();
262  }
263
264  /**
265   * provides the total count of elements, if FB provides them (API &ge; v2.0)
266   *
267   * @return the total count of elements if present
268   * @since 1.6.16
269   */
270  public Long getTotalCount() {
271    return totalCount;
272  }
273
274  /**
275   * returns the order of the elements
276   *
277   * @return the order of the elements
278   */
279  public String getOrder() {
280    return order;
281  }
282
283  public String getBeforeCursor() {
284    return beforeCursor;
285  }
286
287  public String getAfterCursor() {
288    return afterCursor;
289  }
290
291  private String fixProtocol(String pageUrl) {
292    return Optional.ofNullable(pageUrl).filter(s -> s.startsWith("http://")).map(s -> s.replaceFirst("http://", "https://")).orElse(pageUrl);
293  }
294}
